weather_report:
Subiaco settles under a quilt of broken cloud just past midnight, the sky smudged and shy of starlight. Toward dawn the cover thickens to a full gray lid, so first light will be muted, more silver than gold. Expect a soft-focus morning with modest clarity; any sun will arrive filtered and reluctant. UV is negligible now, but after sunrise—spring being what it is here—it will rise quickly even through cloud, so treat midday with respect if you’re lingering outdoors.

Dress in light layers: a long-sleeve or thin jacket for the small hours, something breathable beneath for later. It’s a pleasant, understated kind of day—neither dazzling nor dour—made for quiet errands and gentle starts. Put the kettle on, clear a few emails, take a slow loop of the block before breakfast. After sunrise, a library drop-off, a neat supermarket run, or reorganizing a corner of the shed will suit the dimmer light. If the ceiling loosens, claim a café table under an awning and let the day idle by.
